Detail.Title: Terms of use of the Central Metainformation System of Public Administration
Detail.TitleText: Thank you for using the products and services of the Central Public Administration Metainformation System („MetaIS"), which consists of a web portal at metais.mirri.gov.sk, an architecture modeling tool and a plugin for synchronizing data between the tool itself and the portal. The web portal represents the user interface to the system and the method of entering and presenting data. It is the main channel of the user. BizzDesign Enterprise Studio (hereinafter referred to as „BES”) is a MetaIS component used to enter architectural data in graphical form. This data is synchronized with the web portal, where it can then be supplemented by the user. Synchronization is provided by the so-called synchronization plugin (hereinafter referred to as „plugin”). The plugin enables simple mass changes through the BES tool, and it is therefore up to the authorized employee of the obliged entity (hereinafter referred to as the „user”) to use the plugin exclusively in accordance with the manual and instructions, since incorrect use can cause inconsistencies and errors, which are subsequently difficult to remove. The authorized employee of the liable entity is responsible for the consistency, completeness and accuracy of the information submitted to the MetaIS for the liable entity and its subordinate organizations. By using MetaIS services, you agree to these terms and conditions.
Detail.UsageText: You must not abuse MetaIS services. We may suspend or stop providing you with our Services if you violate our terms of service or rules, or when we investigate suspected inappropriate use. We believe that transparent communication, as is common in open software projects, is a good way forward and that openness creates opportunities to: published data and published content can be used in new and unexpected ways. That's why we also make materials, some of which are intended for specific state administration bodies, available online to everyone. Data obtained through the use of MetaIS services is subject to the Creative Commons Zero license / disclaimer, unless otherwise stated, as it is open data.
Detail.RangeText: We provide our Services using reasonable business skill and care and believe that they will benefit you. However, there are things that we cannot promise you in connection with the MetaIS Services. Neither the Ministry of Ministry of Investments, Regional Development and Informatization of the Slovak Rebublic of the Slovak Republic nor its suppliers make any promises regarding the MetaIS Services, except for those expressly stated in these terms and conditions or supplementary terms. We provide the Services „as is” without warranty. The Ministry of Ministry of Investments, Regional Development and Informatization of the Slovak Rebublic of the Slovak Republic and its suppliers are in no way responsible for any loss or damage that is not reasonably foreseeable. These terms of use only grant you certain rights to use the software. The Ministry of Finance of the Slovak Republic reserves all other rights. You may use the Software only as permitted by these Terms. In doing so, you must comply with any technical restrictions on the software that only allow you to use it in certain ways.

MustNot.Title: You may not:
MustNot.Change: Ministry of Investments, Regional Development and Informatization of the Slovak Rebublic
MustNot.First: circumvent any technical limitations of the software,
MustNot.Second: reverse-analyze, decompile or disassemble the software into components, with the exception of such activity to the extent that it is expressly permitted by the relevant legal order of the Slovak Republic, despite the aforementioned restrictions,
MustNot.Third: provide the Software to others to copy, rent, lease, or loan the Software, transfer the Software or this Agreement to a third party, or use the Software for commercial software hosting services.

Detail.AccountText: You will need an account to use some of the MetaIS Services. The account can be assigned to you by your administrator (who has the role of HKO - main contact person of the liable person). To ensure the security of your account, do not disclose your password to anyone. You bear full responsibility for the activity taking place in your account or the data entered and changed through it. Do not use the same password for the account in third-party applications. If you discover any unauthorized use of your password or account, you must report this fact to the MetaIS administrator at
Detail.ProtectionText: The organization or individual providing information to MetaIS is responsible for the compliance of the submitted information with the law, especially with regard to the Personal Data Protection Act No. 428/2002 Coll. and Art. 13 and 14 GDPR/ § 19 and 20 of Act no. 18/2018 Coll. on the protection of personal data. By using the MetaIS Services, you express your consent to the provision of the following data to MetaIS and to its processing:

loginProblems.heading: Do you have problems logging into the system?

cookies.heading: Cookies usage information
cookies.thisPageUsesCookies1: In order for our page to work, we use necessary cookies. You can find more detailed information about the cookies we use in

settings.heading: Cookie Settings
settings.necessarilyDescription: These are essential cookies that enable you to move around the website and use its features. These cookies do not store any information about you that could be used for marketing or remembering what you've looked at on the internet.
settings.analyticallyDescription: These cookies gather information about how the website is used, such as which pages you visit most often and if you receive error messages. They do not gather information that could identify you. All information is anonymous. They are used to improve the functionality of websites.
settings.preferentialDescription: These cookies store your choices (e.g., language preferences) and personal characteristics. They may store changes you have made on the website. It can be ensured that the information is collected anonymously. Based on them, it is not possible to determine which other websites you have visited.

info.description1: For user-friendly websites and to adapt the operation of our website to your needs, our portal uses cookies. A cookie is a small file that is stored locally on your computer when you visit the website. Cookies also allow us to analyze the use of our websites. They do not contain any personal data and it is not possible to identify you through them on third-party websites - including those of analysis providers.
info.heading2: What cookies do we use and why?
info.description2: We only use necessary cookies that enable the basic functions of our website (operator: Ministry of Investments, Regional Development and Informatization of the Slovak Republic, Pribinova 25, 811 09 Bratislava, metais@mirri.gov.sk) and secure access to website. Our website cannot function without these cookies. Such data processing takes place in accordance with § 55 paragraph 5 of Act No. 351/2011 Coll. on electronic communications. Data will not be shared with third parties or transferred to third parties countries or international organizations.
info.description4: Since these are technical cookies, it is not possible to delete the cookie file.
info.heading5: How can you change cookie settings?
info.description5:
You can accept or reject cookies - including those used to track websites - by choosing the appropriate settings for your browser. You can set your browser to notify you when you receive a new cookie or block them completely.

You can find more information about how to manage the cookies policy of the most used browsers:
  • Google Chrome:
    https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/61416?co=GENIE.Platform%3DDesktop&hl=en
  • Microsoft Edge:
    https://support.microsoft.com/sk-sk/help/4468242/microsoft-edge-browsing-data-and-privacy-microsoft-privacy
  • Mozilla Firefox:
    https://support.mozilla. org/en-US/kb/enable-and-disable-cookies-website-preferences
  • Microsoft Internet Explorer:
    https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/help/17442/windows-internet-explorer- delete-manage-cookies
  • Opera:
    https://help .opera.com/cs/latest/
  • Apple Safari:
    https://support.apple.com/en-gb/safari
In case of further questions about your cookies, contact the responsible person: metais@mirri.gov.sk.

personalDataProtection.description1:
The Ministry of Investments, Regional Development and Informatization of the Slovak Republic (hereinafter referred to as the "Ministry") uses the Central Meta-Information System of the Public Administration of the Slovak Republic to ensure communication with obligated persons. The Central Meta-Information System of the Public Administration of the Slovak Republic is mainly a registration portal that contains data and reports life cycle of data on services, information systems, code books, reference registers and referable identifiers, as well as other components of eGovernment in Slovakia. The purpose of the system is the correctness, completeness and availability of current information.

The Ministry is the administrator of the Central Metainformation System of the Slovak public administration (hereinafter referred to as "MetaIS"). The Ministry processes information only to the extent necessary to fulfill the purpose related to the activities of the Ministry as a public authority, which are specified in § 81 of Act No. 18/2018 Coll. on the Protection of Personal data and on the amendment of certain laws (hereinafter referred to as the "personal data protection law") and according to Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of April 27, 2016 on the protection of natural persons in the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, repealing Directive 95/46/EC (hereinafter referred to as "GDPR")
personalDataProtection.heading2: Who is responsible for processing your personal data on this website?
personalDataProtection.description2:
Ministry of Investments, Regional Development and Informatization of Slovakiaej republiky
Pribinova 25
811 09 Bratislava
metais@mirri.gov.sk
zodpovedna.osoba@mirri.gov.sk
personalDataProtection.heading3: Contact details of the responsible person
personalDataProtection.description3:
metais@mirri.gov.sk (to this email address you can direct questions regarding the use and problems with MetaIS)
metais@mirri.gov.sk (to this email address you can direct questions about the protection of personal data when using MetaIS and apply you have rights under the GDPR)
personalDataProtection.heading4: For what purposes do we process your personal data?
personalDataProtection.description4:
The Ministry processes your personal data for the following purposes:
  • user registration and creation of a user account,
  • communication with the user when solving requests and problems when using MetaIS,
  • informing and communicating about comments and changes to code lists, draft standards and working group agendas.
personalDataProtection.heading5:
What categories of personal data do we process?
We only process general categories of personal data.
personalDataProtection.description5:
1. We process the following personal data from the registration form:
    1. name,
    2. surname,
    3. phone number,
    4. function (optional)
    5. email address,
    6. name of public administration institution.
  2. If the user is also a member of a working group (commission), also:
    1. his inclusion in the working group,
    2. his position /role within the working group,
    3. his choice of choice in the public vote.
  3. The following data is processed about the substantive guarantor of the code books:
    1. name,
    2. surname,
    3. phone number,
    4. email address.
personalDataProtection.heading6: On what legal basis do we process your personal data?
personalDataProtection.description6:
• Act No. 211/2000 Coll. on free access to information and on the amendment of certain laws (the Freedom of Information Act), as amended.
  • Act No. 95/2019 Coll. on Information Technologies in Public Administration and on Amendments and Supplements to Certain Acts, as amended.
personalDataProtection.heading7: How long do we store your personal data?
personalDataProtection.description7: All data is stored for 5 years.
personalDataProtection.heading8: Who will have access to your personal data?
personalDataProtection.description8: Authorized employees of the ministry may have access to your personal data.
personalDataProtection.heading9: Will your personal data be transferred to third countries or an international organization?
personalDataProtection.description9: Your personal data is not transferred to third countries or international organizations.
personalDataProtection.heading10: Does the processing of your personal data by the Ministry involve automated individual decision-making or profiling?
personalDataProtection.description10: The processing of your personal data by the Ministry does not include automated individual decision-making or profiling.
personalDataProtection.heading11: What are your rights and how can you exercise them?
personalDataProtection.description11:
The affected person has the right to request from the Ministry:
  • issuance of a confirmation as to whether or not their personal data is processed by the Ministry, as well as access to their personal data and other information,
  • correction of incorrect, inaccurate or incomplete data relating to it,
  • deletion (so-called forgetting) of personal data relating to it, if one of the reasons listed in Article 17 GDPR is met, for example if :
    • the ministry no longer needs them,
    • the ministry processes them illegally,
  • restriction of processing of personal data concerning it, if one of the cases listed in Article 18 of the GDPR is fulfilled,
  • the right to object to the processing of personal data in Article 21
personalDataProtection.heading12: Is your personal data shared with social media?
personalDataProtection.description12: No, your personal data is not shared with social media.
personalDataProtection.heading13: How is the security of our site ensured?
personalDataProtection.description13: We protect your data during transmission between your browser and our site using the SSL Secure Code Protocol.
personalDataProtection.heading14: Whose personal data do we process?
personalDataProtection.description14: We process personal data about registered users, members of working groups and material guarantors of code lists.
personalDataProtection.heading15: Is the provision of personal data a contractual or legal requirement?
personalDataProtection.description15: Providing personal data for the stated purposes is a contractual requirement between the Ministry and the user. And it is a requirement to create access to MetaIS. In case, that you decide not to provide the minimum necessary personal data, you will only be able to read and write publicly available data, but you will not have access to read and write protected data.
personalDataProtection.heading16: To whom may your personal data be provided?
personalDataProtection.description16: Under certain legal conditions, we may make your personal data available to third parties (such as law enforcement authorities), if this is necessary and appropriate for specific and legally determined purposes.
personalDataProtection.heading17: You have the right to file a complaint with a supervisory authority if you believe that we have handled your personal data unlawfully.
personalDataProtection.description17: You can find a view of the proposal for the initiation of personal data protection proceedings on the website of the office: <a href="https://www.dataprotection.gov.sk/"> www.dataprotection.gov.sk</a > → Forms and samples → Sample of the proposal for the initiation of personal data protection proceedings.
personalDataProtection.heading18: A proposal for the initiation of personal data protection proceedings can be submitted:
personalDataProtection.description18:
• in writing in paper form,
  • in writing in electronic form authorized according to a special regulation on the electronic form of exercise of public authority; electronic submission without authorization according to a special regulation on the electronic form of exercise of public authority of power (i.e. regular email without a guaranteed electronic signature) must be completed in written form within three working days,
  • in person at the personal data protection office orally in the minutes.

termsOfUse.description1:
Thank you for using the products and services of the Central Meta-Information System of the Slovak Public Administration ("MetaIS Services"), which consists of the website at https://metais.slovensko.sk. The website represents the user interface to the system and the method of entering and presenting data. It is the main channel of the user.

An authorized employee of the management body or management body responsible for the consistency, completeness and accuracy of information submitted to MetaIS for this governing body or management body and its subordinate organizations. By using the services of MetaIS, you express your agreement to these terms and conditions.
termsOfUse.description2: You must not abuse MetaIS services. We may suspend or stop providing you with our services if you violate our terms of service or rules, or when we investigate suspected inappropriate use. We believe that transparent communication, as is common in open software projects, is a good way forward and that openness creates opportunities: published data and published content can be used in new and unexpected ways. That's why we also make materials, some of which are intended for specific public administration bodies, available online to everyone. To the data obtained by using the services MetaIS is subject to the Creative Commons Zero license/disclaimer unless otherwise noted, as it is open data.
termsOfUse.description3:
We provide our services using reasonable business skills and care, and we believe that they will benefit you. However, there are things that we cannot promise you in connection with MetaIS services. Neither the Ministry of Investments, Regional Development and Informatization of the Slovak Republic nor its suppliers provide any promises regarding the MetaIS Services except those expressly stated in these terms or supplementary terms. We provide the services without warranties "as is". The Ministry of Investments, Regional Development and Informatization of the Slovak Republic or its suppliers are not responsible for any loss under any circumstances or damage that is not reasonably foreseeable. These terms of use only grant you certain rights to use the software. The Ministry of Investments, Regional Development and Informatization of the Slovak Republic reserves all other rights. You may use the software exclusively in the manner permitted by these terms. You must comply with any technical restrictions on the software that allow it to be used only in certain ways.
You may not:
  • circumvent any technical limitations of the software,
  • reverse-analyze, decompile or disassemble the software into components, with the exception of such activity to the extent that it is expressly permitted by the relevant legal order of the Slovak Republic despite the aforementioned limitations ,
  • provide the Software to others to copy, rent, lease, or loan the Software, transfer the Software or this Agreement to a third party, or use the Software for commercial software hosting services.
The Ministry of Investments, Regional Development and Informatization of the Slovak Republic reserves the right to change the terms of use of MetaIS.
termsOfUse.description4:
On pyou will need an account to use some MetaIS Services. The account will be assigned to you after registration and approval of the application by a representative of the Ministry of Investments, Regional Development and Informatization of the Slovak Republic. You will be notified about the creation of the account via the email you entered when creating the registration.

To guarantee the security of your account, do not disclose the password to anyone. You bear full responsibility for the activity taking place in your account or the data entered and changed through it. Do not use the same password for the MetaIS account in third-party applications. If you discover any unauthorized use of your password or account, you must report this fact to the MetaIS administrator at metais@mirri.gov.sk.

onChange.cleared: All selected options have been cleared.

selected.disabled: option {{label}} is disabled. Select another option.

guidance.menu: Use Up and Down to choose options{{enterText}}, press Escape to exit the menu{{tabText}}.
guidance.enterText: , press Enter to select the currently focused option
guidance.tabText: , press Tab to select the option and exit the menu
guidance.input: {{label}} is focused{{searchText}}, press Down to open the menu{{multiText}}.
guidance.multiText: , press left to focus selected values
guidance.value: Use left and right to toggle between focused values, press Backspace to remove the currently focused value.

aria.selectedRowsCount: You have {{count}} rows selected in table

searchContent.step1: The main search box is used for the main search in the entire application, which offers suggested results according to relevance after entering the text. The longer the entered text string, the more accurate the results. The search takes place in all text fields.
searchContent.step2: Additional search above the table with a list of records searches only in the text fields located in the selected table (i.e. on all pages, in all records of the given table).

filterContent.step1: Above each tabular view with a list of records is additional filtering. The filter menu can be „Collapse filter“ and then collapsed again. The element filtering menu is relevant to the selected table.
filterContent.step2: By clicking on the main „Filter“ button, the previously selected filtering parameters are applied.
filterContent.step3: Selecting „Clear Filtering Criteria“ will unfilter the table and display all table entries. The „Clear filter criteria“ option removes all selected values in the filter but does not cancel the filtered values themselves.

bulkActionsContent.step1: Each list (table of records) contains mass change options. The „Bulk Actions“ button is located above the table with the list of records.
bulkActionsContent.step2: After expanding it, the options for changes above the given group of selected records will be displayed.
bulkActionsContent.step3: Items are selected by ticking the check box at the beginning of each line.

relationContent.step1: Relationships can be created using cards that represent links to related items.
relationContent.step2: Within the given tabs, it is possible to add an item to the currently viewed item by clicking the 'Add new relationship' button, which in terms of relationships represents the creation of a new relationship between the viewed item and an existing item of the selected type.
relationContent.step3: Within the given cards, it is also possible to create a new item of the selected type by clicking the 'Add new item and relationship' button, while in addition to creating the item, a new relationship is also created between the currently viewed item and the created item..

dynamicElements.addRowErrorMessage: You can not add more than {{value}} custom filters.

arrayInput.changeRowsNumber: Number of rows for item {{name}} changed. Number of rows is {{count}}

refIden.hint: If the referenceable identifier you want is not in the list, you can enter its value directly in the field. You will then see the option 'Create:' together with the value you entered.
